intro: Diplotaxis muralis var. biennis, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is an annual herb that grows up to 60 cm tall, featuring slender stems and alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow, dandelion-like flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
